result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy S Fields

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy S Fields in court.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Timothy S Fields.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 3:26 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for 2nd status on 21CF445 and arraignment on 22CF293. Record by Atty. Dickinson that he represents the defendant on 21CF445 only and SPD needs to appoint on new file. As to 21CF445 Atty. requests motion hearing date for motion to suppress. State to file response to motion no later that September 30, 2022.  Court sets this file for motion to suppress and 22CF293 will track to that date as well. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND COVERS 22CF293 & 21CF445

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH. BOND MUST BE CO-SIGNED BY MEGAN LANGHOFF. 

Defendant must reside with mother Carol Fields at 35104 Wisconsin St, Burlington, WI 53105. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CHRISTOPHER MCFADDEN & JAMES WILLIAMS. NO CONTACT WITH STEPHANIE BARTLETT OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Timothy S Fields appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Timothy S Fields.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Called @ 3:09 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for motion to modify bond in 21CF445 and Arraignment in file 22CF293. Record by Atty. Dickinson that he does not represent defendant on the new file, and defendant is waiting for the public defender to appoint on that matter.  Record by Atty. Herrmann who objects to the motion. Court addresses defendant's mother who is present in Court as well as Megan Langhoff who is willing to act as co-signor in this matter. Based on record and discussion, Court grants motion to modify bond as follows:
TOTAL BOND:
Surety bond set in the amount of $10,000.00. Bond must be co-signed by Megan Langhoff
Must post $1000.00 cash
Must reside with his mother, Carol Fields @ 35104 Wisconsin Street; Burlington, WI  53105
SAME PRIOR CONDITIONS

Further record as to status of discovery on this matter and requests that matter be set out about 60 days for additional status.
Court sets both matters for same date. 
Court in recess.
Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:10 PM (64-06) Defendant Timothy S Fields appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Berg in court. 
Court made a record that the Public Defender has informed the court Mr. Fields does qualify for a Public Defender, although they have not been able to secure an attorney for him yet.
Defendant would like to proceed today without an attorney.
Court has colloquy with the defendant for waiver of attorney.
Court grants Waiver of Attorney for this hearing.
State called to the stand as a witness, Matthew Turner from S.O.
Matthew Turner duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Berg.
Witness has identified the defendant on the screen in the court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed in court.
Count #5 has been corrected.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
3:24PM - Cross examination by the defendant.
Defendant is requesting to testify. Court had colloquy with defendant on testifying without  an attorney present. Court finds defendant knowingly and intelligently understands his rights.
Timothy Fields duly sworn by the clerk and testified in an narrative fashion.
Cross examination by ADA Berg.
Re-direct by defendant.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.

3:39PM

64-06 - Andrew Herrmann in court for the State. Timothy S. Fields in court via video. Attorney Daane appeared specially.
Attorney Daane states the SPD Office has a conflict with Mr. Fields and are working on finding him counsel.
Speedy Demand requested.
Attorney Daane is requesting a couple of weeks.
No objection by the State.
Court finds good cause to toll time limits.

Preliminary Hearing scheduled for 07/08/2022 at 3PM before Commissioner Navis.

Adj. 2:07PM

Defendant Timothy S Fields appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA James Sempf.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Timothy S Fields. Called @ 3:15 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on motion to modify bond. Record by Atty. Dickinson as to motion. He has co-signor present in Court and asks that bond be amended covering both files - 21CF445 and 22CF293. Further record by Atty. Dickinson as to new file - 22CF293.  He is not retained on 22CF293 and public defender will be appointed for the defendant regarding that case. As to status on 21CF445, he is still waiting for discovery from the State. Response by the State who has no notes in the file. Response by Atty. Dickinson as to discussions with ADA Herrmann regarding missing video that he still has not received. Atty. cannot proceed on this matter until he has all the discovery. Court takes note and moves to motion to modify bond.
3:19 p.m. - Argument by Atty. Dickinson as to bond motion, and he responds to further questions of the Court. 
3:20 p.m. - Response/argument by DDA Sempf who objection to any bond modification. 
3:22 p.m. - Response and further argument by Atty. Dickinson.
Record by the Court who denies the motion to modify bond at this time. 21CF445 is set for status in about 30 days to address missing discovery, and 22CF293 remains on for preliminary hearing as scheduled.

2:00 PM (64-05) Defendant Timothy S Fields appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Dickinson makes a record that he has not been retained for this case. Requesting a new court date.
Court addressed the defendant regarding hiring Attorney Dickinson. Defendant will be hiring Attorney Dickinson for this case.
Court finds good cause to toll or waive time limits.

Adj. 2:05PM

Defendant in court in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney James Dickenson for defendant. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Dickenson, bond remains. Mother willing to co-sign and money to post. Mother not present. Court not willing to address bond without co-signer. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

BOND TO COVER 22GF529 & 21CF445

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CHRISTOPHER MCFADDEN & JAMES WILLIAMS. NO CONTACT WITH STEPHANIE BARTLETT OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Timothy S Fields in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane for bond purposes only.  Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
